body:
To add a bit of context, I'm trying to make black work with isort. But it seems that black's formatting style is not among isort's list of multi-line output modes (https://github.com/timothycrosley/isort#multi-line-output-modes).

This creates a problem. When I save my python file, it's formatted with black, but isort (flake8-isort) would complain about incorrectly formatted imports, which basically put my code in a bad state.
This is also going to be a problem for Instagram adoption of Black.

This form of wrapping lines applies to all code in Black. Making an exception for imports alone is inconsistent, especially if motivated purely by another, optional tool for Black users.

I'm [talking to](https://twitter.com/llanga/status/984669545993420800?s=21) @timothycrosley about introducing "multiline mode 8" in isort which would enable both tools to peacefully co-exist. I hope this works, if not, we'll think of other options.

rename.from: Imports with parentheses should be per-line with trailing comma
rename.to: Wrapping imports is incompatible with isort

body: Reported on the isort end as https://github.com/timothycrosley/isort/issues/694.
Due to Timothy's silence on the isort end I decided to change how we're formatting imports to be compatible with his valuable tool.

issue.title: Cleanup

repository.name: wsgidav
repository.description: A generic and extendable WebDAV server based on WSGI

issue.body: This is a cleanup pull request, so that additional pull requests could add features or improve programming style

issue.title: Add isort in pre commit configuration file

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
## Description

This add `isort` in the pre-commit configuration file and also apply it on all applicable files. Isort permit to sort import so there is less conflict during merging and rebase of file with conflicting modification. We're using a style of import compatible with `black` and made some efforts so that automated changes made by `black` are not deemed invalid and automatically reverted by `isort` later in the commit hooks : 
* The ignored file are the same
* The line length is the same
* The style of import is compatible (For more detail see https://github.com/ambv/black/issues/127)
* **For comment inside import, there is a minor issue that would require a change in Black : https://github.com/ambv/black/issues/251**

It also update the version of `Black`, and of pre-commit's `trailing-whitespace` and `end-of-file-fixer`



## Type of Changes

| âœ“  | :hammer: Refactoring  |

issue.title: make hook as optional

repository.name: pre-commit
repository.description: A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit hooks.

issue.body:
hey,

first of all thanks for the great framework, it's awesome. I have a config where I have `pylint`, `flake8`, `black` and `isort`. I want to mark `black` and `isort` as optional hooks because when I run, both `black` and `isort` make changes to the files. I want them to run but the failure/success of the commit shouldn't depend upon them... a few months back I only had `black` in my config and it used to work fine... I don't know but recently, if the files were changed during the commit, then the hook is failing.... is there a way to stop if the files were changed don't mark it fail or make a hook as optional ????

issue.title: Add isort to pre-commit hooks
issue.body:
* Add `isort` to pre-commit hook.
* Add `.isort.cfg` so that `isort` is compatible with `black`. See https://github.com/python/black/issues/127 and https://github.com/timothycrosley/isort/issues/694 for discussions on interoperability between `black` and `isort`. 
* Add `seed-isort-config` as an enhancement of `isort`.

issue.title: Add code format check to CI

repository.name: dj-stripe
repository.description: dj-stripe automatically syncs your Stripe Data to your local database as pre-implemented Django Models allowing you to use the Django ORM, in your code, to work with the data making it easier and faster.

issue.body:
Currently we have a flake8 step that also runs isort, it would be good to have this also run tan/black, so unformatted changes cause a CI failure.

Note that isn't quite as simple as running tan or black with `--check`, since they currently disagree with isort about formatting of imports, but something like running ```tan --use-tabs .; isort --apply``` and looking for changes would work.

At this point the flake8 tox step should probably be renamed to "lint" or similar.

body: hmmm.. hit this issue where `black` wants a comma, but `isort` does not...

Added the following to the `.isort.cfg` resolved the issue:

```
[settings]
multi_line_output=3
include_trailing_comma=True
```
